newsitem.title: USA: U.S. aftermarket runs lower for paper Brent trades.
newsitem.headline: U.S. aftermarket runs lower for paper Brent trades.

text.p: North Sea paper Brent markets weakened in late U.S. trading on Thursday, selling in numerous deals for the May month.
Foreign crude traders said May Brent moved between $20.06 and $20.19 a barrel, 3-13 cents lower than the IPE May settlement price at $20.19.
In addition to the outrights, a pair of inter-month spreads sold. A pair of April/May spreads changed hands, the first getting done at +12 cts and the second at +13 cts.
April/May Brent talked late at plus 12-15 cts, traders said.
